data.title: Add support for mp3 format
data.body:
Maps would be nicer if they can have their own music playing.
It should be in the .oramap so its easier to download, and be bundled with the maps.

Uses of that:
- Make it so game and modders triggers can change track and sounds: "1 minute remaining, and fast music song plays". Another track when the attack start in the mission, and triggers when first nuke is sent. etc.. First time godzilla arrive, victory music... Should be controlled by lua
- Make it easy for modders to include track with maps, also on repeat and as environment/ambient background
- Multiple tracks should be allowed to be played at once, like the aud's
- Easy bundling: Mp3 included in .oramap will be played when map starts, with no code needed in yaml or lua

In my humble opinion, this would change a lot about map-modding. It changes the feel of the game.
We did one map with zombies, lightning and thunder, and it was scary. But the music was the old normal songs, and that could really be improved. I would like to bounty this, but at least I want to promote this wish.

See also: #2174 #5491 #8999 #2774



Mailaender commented on the other:

> "The MP3 patents expired recently http://www.audioblog.iis.fraunhofer.com/mp3-software-patents-licenses/ so you can open a new issue if you want that file support added."


Example sound: https://www.freesound.org/people/danielc0307/sounds/24007/
Other sunds: https://www.freesound.org/search/?q=scary&f=&s=duration+desc&advanced=0&g=1

data.title: Eliminated LengthSquared > 0 for slight performance
data.body: It is common in current bleed that LengthSquared is compared with 0. In this case, it is faster to check if all elements are 0 than to perform sum of squared then compare with zero.

data.title: FIX game hang when units with 0 min-range attack units at 0 range.
data.body: Fixes #13307

data.title: Fix attempt at dead-claimer bug in ResourceClaimLayer
data.body: Sometimes, there will be a patch of fully grown Tiberium/ore and no harvesters could harvest it because the claimer is gone without freeing it. This doesn't 100% fix the bug though but I think this is one of the reasons.

data.title: Better in-MinRange-target handling
data.body: Now artillery units are less likely to charge into enemy squads, trying to attack the target in min range.

data.title: Navy separation
data.body:
Naval units are separated from the ground squad, just like aircraft is right now. 
Naval units used to prevent ground units from moving as they can never move near the squad leader, which is a ground unit. (or maybe the other way round)

Depends on my other PR, IsEnemyUnit refactor.

data.title: IsEnemyUnit refactor
data.body:
Many parts of HackyAI use .where for enemy check directly, instead of using isEnemyUnit predicate. Refactoring them.

Also made the predicate public, as it is useful to use from Squad code.

data.title: GroundState performance improvement
Fix empty lobby faction tooltips.
data.body:
Fixes #13599.
Fixes #13567.

data.title: Revert "Replace legacy Evaluator with IntegerExpressions."
data.body: This works around #13526 so that we don't have to rush the much more complicated better fix.

data.title: Allow spectators to place beacons
data.body:
#10390
Only supports ra mod for now, should only require editing yaml files to
work in other mods

data.title: Factions with no description crash the lobby
data.body:
If a selectable faction has no description, it crashes the game with some yaddayadda exception that most modders surely won't be able to interpret.

We should either add `FieldLoader.Required` to `Faction.Description` so it throws a meaningful error (though that would cause redundancy on unselectable factions), or fix the crash and just show no description if none is defined.

data.title: RangeMultiplier
data.body: RangeMultiplier does not affect no nothing! :)

data.title: Improve Armament overridability
data.body:
The `CheckFire` barrel part is quite monolithic, anyone wanting to modify it in a trait that inherits `Armament` risks overlooking/breaking something unless the whole thing is copy-pasted and then modified, which has the downside of potentially missing upstream changes.

This PR tries to ease the situation by splitting the "can fire" check at the beginning, the actual "fire barrel" logic in the middle and the "update Burst" part at the end into separate, overridable methods, so each part  of the code can be overridden or replaced more easily and independently from the rest.

Reviewing commit by commit is recommended.

data.title: Add search fields to the map editor template and actor lists.
data.body: This PR wraps up @rob-v's editor improvements by adding a search field to filter actors/tiles by name/id/category/tooltip. It also adds the template ID to the current cell display so that mappers can quickly identify and filter/select any tile on the map. Supersedes #13337. ~~Depends on #13339, #13353.~~

data.title: Make engineer fix power-down from infiltration
data.body:
followup from #13588 and http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=20186

```
once you are under a power-outage (and the powerplants are black) ... engineers can enter these powerplants and fix that problem immediately ?

so when youre having a engineer ready in your base, ready near a powerplant (which is mostly a costly risk) ... you would benefit ?

and it would be a 500 - 500 trade ... thats the cost for a spy and an engi (except for the british one of course)

this would give the spys an excellent reason to use their silent--pp before entering a powerplant
```

data.title: lack of stackable traits
data.body: i've been doing a bit of modding recently in an effort to find a use for the Forward Command structure in the Red Alert mod that wasn't build radius or vision range; my idea was to make it similar to the Veteran Academy from RA3 where in by you capture the Forward Command and all newly trained units you produce will be granted a rank up from the get-go. this idea can be done with a Prerequisite called 'ArmoryLevelUp' and then change the Prerequisite on the units from the building.upgraded to house that Prerequisite within the trait 'ProducibleWithLevel' but it only does it to rank 1 (although gives you an idea what is after); now it is possible to do it in Lua and work out a way to stack traits from the Yaml so this trick will work... good luck in working that one out and get back to me when progress has been made, i'll attempt to work something out as well so we can keep brainstorming through :)

data.title: Add a CommandBarBlacklist trait to blacklist Stop and Waypoint Mode
data.body: Otherwise they are visible for buildings. I kept "Stop" enabled for defenses.

data.title: Add a global script for campaign missions in d2k
data.body: Especially the AI methods were duplicated a lot. Fixes also some other bugs/oversights (+ general polish).

data.title: Spatial Audio and Map Zoom
data.body:
Hi, the spatial audio (hearing shots from the left if the action is left of me) works well if no zoom is applied.
After zooming, the spatialization is "too hard"; I mean audio is panned too much left if I slightly scroll to the left (but the action is already pretty center on my screen).

Example scene attached:
![ra_audio_spat_bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3219690/27862511-cbf5e7a4-6185-11e7-8651-3de350fa7670.png)
The sound effects are comming from the very left in this situation as if the action were not on the screen.

Is that by purpose?

Glocke

data.title: Update package-all.sh
data.body:
- Remove subshells and instead use bash parameter expansion.
- Utilize a function with a subshell to make adding additional packages easy.

data.title: Paradrop planes might not be able to leave the map.
data.body: Basically #11784 but with ParatroopersPower.

data.title: Power-outage only when entering advanced powerplants
data.body:
The "Power-Outage" that a spy can cause, when he is entering a powerplant is quite powerful ... in order to make this situation a bit more avoidable it should be limited on "advanced powerplants"

players could put those adv.powerplants in certain areas (to keep an eye on it easier) and/or use cheap fences to keep any foreign bodies out from entering their powerplants)

the spy-move is just too easy since theres is powerplants everywhere ... and it gets harder to avoid on bigger maps ...

data.body:
The current way the beachtiles are sorted is not very logical. Some of the tiles that seem to belong to one group are placed somewhere else. More logical grouping (in my opinion):

Small corner group:
413, 414, 415, 416

Big corner group:
417, 418, 423, 424, 425, 426, 427, 428, 429, 430

Group beach right, water left:
419, 420, 424, 437, 438, 441

Group beach left, water right:
421, 422, 435, 436, 442

Group beach top, water below:
400, 401, 402, 403, 404, 405, 431, 432, 439, 440

Group beach below, water on top:
406, 407, 408, 409, 410, 411, 412, 433, 434

extremely low priority, but desert beach tile 438 has a black cell when placed

data.title: Stop spies being crushed by ore trucks
data.body:
Currently, ore trucks will crush disguised spies. That seems illogical to me. I think ore trucks should be able to force crush spies, with user input (just as they can be force fired upon), otherwise they should be avoided. 

Whether spies are OP is a different matter (see e.g. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/12228). 


keywords: spy, spies, harvester, ore truck, crush, run over

data.title: WeaponInfo in current form can force mods to use non-custom engine
data.body:
`WeaponInfo` is located in the engine and not overridable/inheritable, so in order to add fields, it currently has to be modified directly.

This requires mods which need a feature that bleed doesn't have to ship custom engine builds, which basically blocks one of the intentions of the engine->mod separation (leaving the engine untouched and doing any customisation in mod code).

Ideally we'd find a way to make it inheritable, moving it to `Mods.Common` alone would still require custom OpenRA builds.

One possibility - though maybe not the most practial in terms of yaml setup and performance - might be to simply get rid of `WeaponInfo` entirely and move all its properties to `Armament`*.
Each weapon could then be defined as inheritable default like this: [example](https://gist.github.com/reaperrr/f08c720e952c5b14bbffbcb8e6753d82)
The main problem I see is cases where a weapon is currently not fired by an actor, but that shouldn't be an unsolvable issue.



*or, if that would make it too much of a behemoth of a trait, simply a new, separate `Weapon` trait that only houses the old WeaponInfo stuff.

data.title: AI Harvester keep spinning in map Winter Storm (Live Locking)
data.body:
When the bot in northeast starting point builds a refinery near the gems, then the ClosestHarvestablePos in FindResources.cs fails. What happens next is it moves to UnblockCell, wait a little bit of time then comes back to FindResources activity. It fails again. As a result, it will move between self.location and UnblockCell.

Humans can sort this out but for bots, I think it should call Cancel() so that it becomes idle state: FindNextResource in HackyAI.cs will sort this harvester out eventually.

I'll see of this happens in current Stable.

Add: Human players harvester doesn't get live locked

data.title: finalOverlayRenderables.GroupBy candidate for optimization
data.body:
Candidate for optimization.

Of all time spent in Linq methods 7% of the time is spent in only the GroupBy below. 

It may be more efficient to just loop over all types and render if type matches. Since now you seem to loop twice over the same set.

```c#

WordlRenderer.cs

void Draw()
{

                        // HACK: Keep old grouping behaviour
                        foreach (var g in finalOverlayRenderables.GroupBy(prs => prs.GetType()))
                                foreach (var r in g)
                                        r.Render(this);

}
```

Called 87k times. 0.101 seconds spent total. 0.0011 msec on avg.

Other heavy Linq calls are located in GenerateRenderables but these seem to make more sense as you are creating renderers. 

I won't report the rest, they seem to make sense or are trivial.

data.title: aboveShroudEffects Select as operator
data.body:
The below Select shows up as one (2nd worst) of the most heavy Linq queries in the game - after initialization. 

I must be caused by the ```as``` operator - which i guess needs to do type lookups.

Perhaps you could store the different type of effects in different containers. I understand there are many type of effects. Not sure what the best solution is.

```c#
WorldRenderer.cs

WordlRenderer.Draw()
{
     var aboveShroudEffects = World.Effects.Select(e => e as IEffectAboveShroud)
                                .Where(e => e != null)
                                .SelectMany(e => e.RenderAboveShroud(this));

}

```

Called 173 thousand times. 170 msec total spent in 15min game. Avg  response time 0.00097 msec.

Of all time spent in all Linq calls, 12% of the time is spent in this Select call.

I.e. the other Selects in the same Draw method are less heavy.
